page.title: 09Bridgerule Stores
page.content: The local newsagent's shop used to be part of the brewery owned by the village inn. After this it was a tailor's shop and has had five previous owners. The present owners have lived in Bridgerule for fifteen years and now run the shop as a general store selling packet and tinned foods, newspapers and household items such as sewing and cleaning materials and stationery. The Post Office is run by a father and son team who have lived in Bridgerule all their lives. The shop doubles as a grocer's shop, and although very small, stocks everything imaginable from toothpaste and cotton wool to fresh cut ham and cheese. Together, these two shops provide the local residents with everyday needs as well as being friendly meeting places.
